results.title: Writing for real
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: Documentary about the way in which a group of Year 10 students work with a local facility for elderly people to develop their understanding of the workplace, exploring their relationships between people and the workplace and apply school-based learning to a practical suggestion.

results.title: Writing better business letters
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Emphasizes the three principle characteristics of a good business letter - clarity, brevity, and courtesy. States the simple principle of letter writing, how to write letters easily and naturally.

results.title: Wrestling fundamentals
results.creator_credit: D Richardson and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: The film illustrates the moves and countermoves required in good amateur wrestling. Illustrates rules, takedowns, pinholds and the techniques of chain wrestling.

results.title: WR. Mysteries of the organism (E)
results.brief_description: Dusan Makavejev’s collage approach to “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” effectively connects a disparate collection of themes, styles and ideas, starting with a documentary on controversial Polish born sexologist Wilheim Reich, a panorama of the American sexual revolution of the 60’s and 70’s, and finally, a satire set in the former Yugoslavia on the sexually repressive nature of authoritarian movements. The Reich segment covers the famed psychologists career from his flight from Europe in the late 30’s to his settlement in the United States where he established his research laboratory. His unconventional studies on ‘orgone energy’, coupled with his communist background made him a prime target for McCarthy’s communist witchhunts, resulting in his books being burned and his eventual incarceration and death in prison. Makavejev juxtaposes Reich’s life work with a fictional narrative of a liberated Yugoslavian woman (Milena Dravic), trying to enlighten a politically indocrinated and repressed Russian skater (Vladimir Ilyich) to the Reichian ethos of revolution via free love. In English language with some subtitles (Note: This particular version of “Wr. Mysteries of the Organism” is a modified version specially prepared by Makavejev to comply with British television standards.) See also “The Switchboard operator” (1969), “The Coca Cola kid” (1985).

results.title: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens
results.creator_credit: Thomas Gilou, Aissa Djabri, Farid Lahouassa, Manuel Munz, France Z, Les Productions Jacque Roiffeld, M6 Films, Orly Films and Vertigo Productions
results.brief_description: No job, no home, no family; Eddie (Richard Anconina) has hit rock bottom. One day, as he is walking through Le Sentier (the rag trade district of Paris) he is attacked by a gang of hustlers. Rescued by Victor Benzakem (Richard Bohringer), a successful rag-trader who mistakes Eddie for a Sephardic Jew, Eddie is offered a job. Only too happy to seize an opportunity to start over, Eddie (who is a gentile) tries his best to maintain the pretence of his adopted ‘jewishness’. From the fabric warehouse, Eddie is given an opportunity to observe the rites and secret hand shakes of the flashy, fast talking garment district: a melting pot of race, religion and culture. His eyes also catch the beauty of his employer’s daughter, Sandra (Amira Casar). In order to draw her attention, Eddie decides to cut loose and start his own business. Starting with the classic story of the stranger who finds himself in a community he knows nothing about, Thomas Gilou’s film presents a seldom-seen look into the lives and customs of France’s many ethnic groups. Cast includes Richard Anconina, Amira Casar, Vincent Elbaz, Elie Kakou, Richard Bohringer, and Jose Garcia.
results.title_for_label: Would I lie to you = la verite si je mens

results.title: Wot! no art
results.brief_description: An analysis of British society since 1945, and the relationship or lack thereof, of art to the people. Deals with the problem of people understanding and accepting “modern art”. “Art must be thought of as a basic human need, instead of a luxury that our society can only just afford”

results.title: Worth the risk
results.brief_description: To most people a road accident is something which always happens to the other fellow, yet, as the film points out, sooner or later one in every six people alive today will be involved in one. Every day road accidents occur on average one every three and a half minutes, yet everyday, pedestrians, cyclists, and motorists continue to take risks.
